reviewText: As a longtime fan of wrestling, not to mention owner of the previous 17 Wrestlemanias on video, I have to say that this was by far one of the WORST Wrestlemanias to date.  First of all, there was absolutely nothing spectacular about this event.  There were three musical performances.  One of which was in the beginning of the show which made me wonder if this was a wrestling event or a rock concert.  Secondly the matches were nothing special.  You could turn on RAW Monday nights and see the same calabre of matches that were given at Wrestlemania X8.The only exception (which is why I'm giving this 2 stars instead of 1) is the Hogan/Rock match.  This was basically the only match I enjoyed during the entire 3 1/2 hours I sat and watched this.  It was nice to see Hogan have a quality match in a WWF ring once again, and he definitely proved that he still rocks.All in all, this doesn't come close to being one of the best Wrestlemanias ever.  Last year's (X7) was a million times better than this.

Epic confrontation, truly a classic. Don't miss this. 8.5/1010. Women's Championship Match: Jazz vs. Lita vs. Trish StratusStandard women's match. If you've seen one, you've seen 'em all. reviewText: WrestleMania X8 was one of the most over-hyped Manias of all time. Not saying that all WrestleManias are not hyped before the event starts, but the way X8 was hyped is an insult to the latest and greatest WrestleManias. (X7, 2000, XX and XIX)You see, X8 suffers from the fact that it's the WM after X7, the greatest event of wrestling in history, so it'd be near impossible to come near it, especially considering that X8 used guys that shouldn't be in the spotlight anymore, for example Hogan and Trips (Not saying that HHH should be retired, but c'mon, a mainevent with a guy with a bad leg who beats an up and coming, and more deserving and talented wrestler?) and that X8's main attraction was the Hogan/Rock bout.... more on that later.Here's the list of the card, along with a small review:1.RVD vs. Regal- IC TitleFair match, a little slow and some fairly entertaining moves, but the bottom line is, the styles don't complement eachother and it was a fairly boring opener. C+2.DDP vs. Christian- Euro TitleA surprising match whch isn't bad, but the way this match was under-hyped makes the match look worse than what it was. No real memorable details, but worth watching once. Why Christian is so underrated is beyond me... he has great ring psychology and mic skills. B-3.Goldust vs. Maven- Hardcore TitleThis match is like a cracker with no dip... maybe even half a cracker with no dip. Gimmicky finish. C---4.Kane vs. Kurt AngleWhy Kane was even in a WM is beyond me- and why Kurt's talents are wasted with Kane is also mind-blowingly stupid. Kane makes Kurt look boring. C+5.Ric Flair vs. UndertakerOne of the better matches on the card. Too bad that both men are slow and that the match is mainly a squash match, but the heavy blood flow and the fact that it's two legends is entertaining either way. B6.Edge vs. BookerBad storyline leading up to WM, and fairly sloppy match to end it. This will make you think- why wasn't the Kurt/Edge hair vs. hair match here instead of Judgment Day? B-7.Austin vs. HallGood match, but more worthy of an average PPV, not WM. Not pushed to its potential. B-8.Four Team Elimination Match- Tag TitlesBy now your brain should've been wiped of entertainment, and you won't remember anything from this match. Why did a temporary team win? C+9.Rock vs. HoganThe match of the decade/millenium/whatever made this card what it is. Kinda in-a-way. This match is an average bout with no real surprises. Kicking out of finishing moves excite you? Then give this match an A, but realistically this match was overhyped and predictable and the storylines leading up to it was lame. At least the crowd kept the match exciting. Kind of anyway... C+10.Lita vs. Jazz vs. Trish- Women's TitleWho cares? It's just a filler between the Rock/Hogan match and HHH/Jericho match. skip it. No grade needed.11.Jericho vs. Trips- Undisputed TitleOne of the worst matches on the card. What a WM Mainevent shouldn't be. The storyline was more in the shadow of the HHH/Steph feud, and the match was slow and Toronto just didn't give a damn about it. The rematch with both men at Judgment Day in Hell in the Cell is 10 times better. Jericho didn't wrestle to his potential and HHH was in no shape to be there. C-Worth missing out on.

reviewText: The eighteenth annual "Wrestlemania" was the last to wear the WWF moniker before it was legally forced to change to World Wrestling Entertainment.Once you look past the "dream match" featuring "Hollywood" Hulk Hogan and The Rock, there really isn't much to this event. Hogan vs. Rock is not exactly a scientific classic as both men stretch their limited list of moves as far as it gets. This match lives up to its hype, though like most of the card, the outcome is predictable.There lies the biggest problem with most of this card. While we are getting to see a few big first-time meetings, it's clear that the younger guys are gonna win. It's about the veterans passing the torch. reviewText: Well, this wasn't the greatest Wrestlemania ever by any means, but there were a LOT of very well-done matches and a little bit of history to add flavor.Most everybody's probably seen this Pay-Per-View by now; and while it wasn't the best, it was certainly one of the longest.  Ten huge matches in the Mania itself, culminating with Triple H's Undisputed Title victory over Chris Jericho.  Of course, this was a few matches after arguably the most historic matchup in pro wrestling history: Hulk Hogan vs. The Rock.  Although the match was great, the exhausted crowd had nothing left after 'Icon vs. Icon', so it seemed as though the sold-out Skydome wasn't even into it.The DVD set comes with a plethora of extras, which is standard WWE fare.  Interviews, next-night ramifications, you name it.  And, like the WWE itself, the X8 DVD has its ups and downs.  The best moments on the DVD to me were the Rock interview, William Regal vs. Rob Van Dam, and of course Hogan vs. Rock.  I could've done without the live band performances; either the sound equipment was malfunctioning, or the bands were just plain bad (probably a little bit of both).  Also, that stale four-way dance for the tag titles never should have happened.The best feature on the DVD set by far, though, is the little trip in the Wayback Machine that is the main event from Wrestlemania VI between Hulk Hogan and the Ultimate Warrior.  The 30-minute marathon match that changed not only the guard, but the very face of the then-WWF.  A true clash of the titans, seeing this match again in its entirety brought back memories of youth and durn near brought a tear to my eye.  Hopefully this will pave the way for more classic WWF DVDs in the future.It had its moments, both good and bad, but all in all this is a pretty wise investment for wrestling fans who want tastes of old and new school in the same shot.

reviewText: This one was as close to a perfect DVD as one could get. It had a great card along with great extras! The extras are nice and even features a bonus match with Hulk Hogan Vs. The Ultimate Warrior from WrestleMania VI! But, it is ultimately the card itself that sells the DVD so let's get to it:Rob Van Damn Vs. William Regal(WWE Intercontinental Championship Match) - A good opener. Many thought that the clash of styles might be a problem but it worked out okay. Despite his critics, William Regal might be one of the better workers out there while RVD......well, he's RVD!Diamond Dallas Page Vs. Christian (WWE European Championship) - This match was better than expected! I thought it would be boring but the two put on a decent showing. This turned out to be DDP's last PPV bout due to a neck injury that he suffered about two weeks later or so. At least he fulfilled one of his dreams and that was to compete at WrestleMania.Maven Vs. Goldust (WWE Hardcore Championship) - This one was a bit boring but got interesting as the "24/7 rule" was reinstituted for this match. We saw Spike Dudley, Al Snow, The Hurricane, Christian and even Molly Holly get involved in this! It made for some good light comedy.Kane vs. Kurt Angle - This one was actually a good bout but a horribly botched ending due to Kurt Angle (a rarity for him since he's usually on point with his matches). A good bout nonetheless.Ric Flair vs. Undertaker - If not for Rock Vs. Hogan, THIS would've been the match of the night without a doubt! For two guys past their 40's (Flair is mid 50's), they did what guys half their age can't do! Only wished they could've got Tully Blanchard and Ole Anderson for a real Horsemen run in but all in all, I can't complain. Great match!Edge vs. Booker T - Not a bad match. Had a couple of good spots.Stone Cold Steve Austin vs. Scott Hall - Now, there is a slight controversy over this bout. Originally, Hall was supposed to win but Austin insisted on not jobbing and the nWo agreed. Some might complain and I am not a big Austin fan but how many times did the nWo get the job in the old WCW? Poetic Justice to me. Anyway, not a great match but watchable.Four-Team Elimination WWE Tag Team Championship - Unless you just like these teams, just skip this match!The Rock vs. Hollywood Hulk Hogan - This match was the true main event of WrestleMania 18. I don't care what HHH says (though I do agree with him in principle that the WWE title should be the main event at WrestleMania, I think an exception should've been made here), THIS IS THE MAIN EVENT! The crowd was all into it. The biggest surprise was the crowd as they not only booed The Rock despite the fact he was a face and Hogan was the heel, they brought energy to the match! You'll love it just for the crowd reactions alone!Triple Threat WWE Women's Championship - I felt bad for Jazz, Lita and Trish Stratus as this was actually a good three way match! On another night, these women would've gotten the applause they deserved but coming after Hogan/Rock was an unenviable task. The crowd, while appreciative of the efforts, were emotionally drained.Triple H Vs. Y2J (Undisputed WWE Championship) - This one was decided before the two stepped into the ring. It wasn't exciting to begin with and coming behind Rock/Hogan, the crowd was just waiting for this match to be over with by this point. If you want to see a good HHH Vs. Jericho match, may I recommend renting or buying WWF Fully Loaded 2000 for the Last Man Standing match! That one was classic!All in all, a great DVD!

reviewText: March 17, 2002 - Where were you when Hulk Hogan wrestled The Rock? I was sitting at home, cheering like a madman. This was the most incredible wrestling encounter I have ever witnessed. These two men, especially a middle aged Hogan, electrified the crowd and the world audience. The two greatest performers in pro wrestling oozed charisma and intensity, providing the audience with a truly historic and unforgettable match. Not since Wrestlemania 3, when a young Hogan met Andre the Giant, has a Wrestlemania match been as unforgettable and historic as Hogan/Rock. It was a joy to watch. The wrestling may not have been the most technicially sound, but it entertained the crowd and the fans at home. Is that what not wrestling is all about? The age of the Internet mark ruined my perspective on pro wrestling, making one believe that the number of close falls, counter moves, and technical merit measures how good a match is. But in reality, the true measuring stick of a great match is the atmosphere it creates. When I was a kid, it was marking out for great moments and characters that made watching a show fun. This was one of those moments; a genuinely special moment. Sure Hogan is over the hill, and he could have easily mailed in the effort and still left with a hefty check. He gave you all he had, even if that is not that much at this point. And for that, the much reviled Hogan should be applauded. He was there in MSG all the way back in 1985, and helped make Wrestlemania the tradition it is. And in 2002, Hulk Hogan showed that despite all the criticism heaped upon him (i.e., backstage manipulator, terrible worker, etc.) he is truly a great legend of wrestling, who inspired us all to embrace the business that made him a star. Sure, the match was no Steamboat-Savage. But, sometimes the moment is all we have, and all we should do is savor it. Hogan-Rock was one of those once in a lifetime moments, and I savored every second of it.

reviewText: Wrestlemania X8 was a great event. It had eleven matches all together, with the best being Hollywood Hulk Hogan vs. The Rock. Personally, I can't see why anyone would be annoyed with this classic match. The so-called "wrestling fans" that were upset that Hogan was featured as the headliner are not as big fans as they think. This was Hulk's last Wrestlemania. He's not going to be around for more than a few more months before he retires. He deserved to go out the way hecame into the WWF, on top. The card was good and delivered what eveyone expects from Wrestlemania, it was a notch above the usual WWF pay-per-view. At the beginning of the event the camera was awful and with the perfomances of Saliva and Drowning Pool on the way, I thought that it was going to be a long night. But before the first match was over I had changed my mind. The pace of the show picked up and never let up for about three and half hours. Grant it there were no gimmick matches(cage matches, TLC, etc.) but that was becuase the event stood well enough on its own. Hogan and Flair (the two oldest men on the card), gave two of the best performances, along with Rob Van Dam. I saw Hogan do moves he has never ever done, even when he was as young as the Rock. There really wasn't a bad match and every WWF title was on the line. The Chris Jericho/ Triple H match shouldn't have been last because both men have given better performances. You could tell the work that went into the set and production which makes the event really feel like the blockbuster it is. This isn't the best entry into the Wrestlemania series but it is still one of the best of the eighteen we have seen so far. It's a great wrestling show with some memorable matches, that should not be missed by any wrestling fan.

reviewText: This had one of the most exciting cards of all time, however, the event just did not deliver for one reason or another. Out of 5 stars. . .IC Championship: William Regal (c) vs. Rob Van Dam. 3 stars, good opener, if not a little obvious in the outcome, but RVD did not go all out for WrestleMania. This is the second WrestleMania in a row that Regal has opened in and IC title match.European Championship: Diamond Dallas Page (c) vs. Christian. 3 stars, good match, but was really just there to fill up time, and you can tell by the quality of work.Hardcore Championship: Maven (c) vs. Goldust. 2 stars, This match continued on throughout the night, however, with those mini-matches ranging in star-value, but the "mother match" seemed very out of place.Kane vs. Kurt Angle. 3 and a half stars, good match, but not what I've come to expect from these two very experienced workers. Disappointing, but still very good.Ric Flair vs. Undertaker. 3 and a half stars, okay match, but WAY too long, with so many slow spots that I actually drift off every time I try to watch it now. Props to Arn Anderson for the best spine buster I've ever seen.Edge vs. Booker T. 4 stars, very good match, but they weren't given enough time, thus not being able to tell the story. Granted the story line [stunk], but still a great match.Stone Cold vs. Scott Hall. 3 and a half stars, okay match, but nothing special AT ALL. I don't understand, why, if Scott Hall was such a long shot, they didn't just do Stone Cold vs. Nash. I would have rather seen that anyway. Oh well, just one man's opinion.Tag Team Championship: Billy & Chuck (c) vs. Hardyz vs. APA vs. Dudleyz. 4 stars, good match, good storytelling, but lackluster after the last to WrestleMania tag title matches. Screwjob ending takes the rating down.The Rock vs. Hollywood Hulk Hogan. 4 stars, very fun match, but despite how much Rocky desperately carries Hogan, the old boat-anchor still slows it down to unbearable levels. Still, very fun and very good.Women's Championship: Jazz (c) vs. Lita vs. Trish Stratus. 3 stars, good women's match, if not a little anti-climactic. But why did they keep that belt on Miss Charisma instead of giving it to home town girl or Miss eXtreme???Undisputed Championship: Chris Jericho (c) vs. Triple H. 4 stars, a good match, but lackluster for the main event. The crowd was kind of out of it after the exhausting icon vs. icon. A little too long, with Jericho dragging it down with too much technicality, and Triple H with too much falling down and whining. Steph is MVP of the match.

reviewText: Too bad everyone says this WrestleMania sucks, because it acually is really good. I'll run down all the matches and give ratings on all of them:1. RVD def. William Regal to win the Intercontinental Title - great opener. Some really good mat wrestling in this match, with those brass knucks coming into play again. Rating: 8/102. DDP def. Christian to retain the European Championship - another ok match. A little boring at times, but wasn't too bad. Rating: 6/103. Spike def. Goldust and Maven to win the Hardcore Championship - for about the first 5 minutes or so, it was just Goldust and Maven using shovels, garbage cans, lids, etc. Spike came down and pinned Maven (I think). Rating: 7/104. Kurt Angle def. Kane - a very solid, physical match. A lot of great suplexes from Angle, and some power moves from Kane. Watch this match, as it really is pretty good. Rating: 8.5/105. Undertaker def. Ric Flair in a No DQ match - this is the event where Undertaker goes an amazing 10-0 at Mania events! The most brutal match on the card sure didn't let anyone down. Arn Anderson makes an appearance at the end of the match but gets bloodied up again by Taker. Chairs, signs, pipes, and a ton of punches (mostly by Taker) were used in this brawl. Very good match and probably tied with Hogan/Rock for match of the night. Rating: 10/106. Edge def. Booker T - this match wasn't anything too special, but it definetly wasn't as bad as everyone thinks. I don't think this match should be on WrestleMania, but it was an ok match. Rating: 5/107. Stone Cold def. Scott Hall - another nice brawl by both men. Kevin Nash destroys every ref around before being restrained by several cops, etc. Definetly wasn't a classic Stone Cold match, but it wasn't too bad. Pretty decent storyline as well. Rating: 8/108. Billy and Chuck def. The Acolytes, The Dudley Boys, and the Hardy Boys in a Fatal Four Way match to retain the Tag Team Championships - nothing bad, but I was kind of unhappy with who won, considering Billy and Chuck were the worst team in the match. Nice table spot with D-Von brought this match up another point. Rating: 7/109. The Rock def. Hollywood 'Hulk' Hogan - a very classic match. I get goosebumps everytime I watch this match, especially at the end of the match and after the match with Hulk Hogan and The Rock shaking hands. Watch this match, because it was way better than their No Way Out 2003 match. Rating: 10/1010. Jazz def. Trish Stratus and Lita to retain her Women's Championship - I don't know why this match was so high up on the card, but it wasn't too bad considering it was a women's match. Nothing else I can say I guess. Rating: 7.5/10 (extra point because Trish and Lita were looking pretty good :D)11. Triple H def. Chris Jericho to win the Undisputed WWF Championship - why is there so much complaining about this match? Don't you guys understand that Triple H was injured really bad with a sledghammer on the final RAW before Mania? This match was very good considering he was injured. Great table spot with Triple H. Rating: 9/10 (Drowning Pool played Triple H to the ring with their version of 'The Game').The Hardcore title switched hands a lot at Mania. The order was this:Spike Dudley after pinning MavenHurricane after pinning Spike DudleyMolly after pinning HurricaneChristian after pinning MollyMaven after pinning ChristianSo basically, I really enjoyed this WrestleMania. Musical performances were by Saliva and Drowning Pool, which weren't too bad. WrestleMania 17 was a little better, but this one was right up there with it, considering the WWF was going downhill at the time. Buy this DVD as it has tons of extras. Extras include:Superstars favorite moments in WrestleMania history (disk 1)Top 3 attendances in Mania history (disk 1)Top 5 moments in Mania history (disk 1)Vince McMahon on Byte This! (disk 1 or 2... I don't remember)Rock/Hogan promos and buildup to their big match (disk 2)Hulk Hogan vs. Ultimate Warrior at WrestleMania 6 (disk 2 I believe)Some other extras that might be good but I forget. Buy this WrestleMania!!

reviewText: Regal vs. RVDAn extremely good match to open the show, both men showed a lot of promise and some bone chilling moves. Only gripe here is length as it was only about 6 minutes, if given 5 more minutes it would have achieved a much higher score. Still very good however and very well done start to the show!RATING: 80/100DDP vs. ChristianA good match that at times seemed a bit lackluster but not at all bad, my favourite finisher of all time to end the match for DDP.RATING: 76/100Goldust vs. MAvenThis match unfortunately had hardly any time to get going and when it looked promising Spike came in to take the win. Not bad but not at all good.RATING: 68/100Angle vs. KaneI found this match very interesting to see how Angle would help Kane to a good match, and once again Angle showed his tremendous wrestling ability by doing exactly that - a very good match. Kane brought his strength and Angle brought his skills which made for a very good, exciting match.RATING: 82/100Ric Flair vs. UndertakerAlthough I was expecting quite a lot more from this one, it didn't really disappoint in the end and basically had everything necessary for a good no dq match. I got the feeling of quite a few botched moves however, with Undertaker's Last Ride not working nor a few of Flair's stunts. These didn't damage the much but disturbed the flow a little bit. Still very good match, but could have been better. Glad to see Taker keep his Wrestlemania record alive!RATING: 84/100Booker T vs. EdgeNot bad at all but not exceptionally good either. Good, mediocre match over a hair shampoo.RATING: 70/100Scott Hall vs. Steve AustinThis match was actually quite a lot better than I thought it would be as I didn't think that Hall had any skills before I saw the match. He impressed me a bit and with help from outside interference, the match got more exciting and was longer than otherwise. Very enjoyable match!RATING: 81/100WWF Tag Team Title Fourway EliminationQuite an exciting tag match that had some good moments. Good elimination rule to make this match relatively long. Well done to Hardys for making match enjoyable!RATING: 67/100Hogan vs. RockVery hard to rate, but this match had one major problem and a few really good things:a)Rock kicked out of leg drop (Good!)b)Some very close counts (Good!)c)Only about 15 minutes in length (Terrible!)This match was running very nicely until it ended with Rock's patented People's Elbow, and I would think this match could have got a nice 90 if it was 10 minutes longer. What was there was good though but not quite as good as what so many people say it is <my opinion>.Overall: A great match that was far too short to be announced best match ever or get into 90's. With another 10 minutes, yes.RATING: 87/100Jazz vs. Trish vs. LitaAs always for any match following a big match, it is hard to do well. But I was overwhelmed at how hard these girls tried to do their best and it was actually one of the better woman's matches I have ever seen! Well done girls!RATING: 75/100HHH vs. Y2JI would have to say that this was the biggest disappointment on the card for me. Both of these superstars were at their prime at this stage and could have stolen the show, however with consistent interference by Stephanie, the match never really got started for me and I wasn't on the edge of my seat once. Highly disappointing Wrestlemania main event, although not a bad match only acceptable for midcard.I do feel that all Wrestlemania main events should be scoring at least a high 80 with me, and this completely failed to get even close.RATING: 78/10077% - On the whole, it was a very good PPV that was always entertaining.Main event huge disappointment but Rock vs. Hogan match saved it a bit.Major problem here also was that no match on the entire PPV was good enough to score a 90, and Wrestlemania should always have at least one 90 to make the show great.

reviewText: This was a history making night as we would witness a match that fans wouldn't have dream would happen as it was the professional wrestling's past against the future in a true "Icon vs. Icon" showdown.Intercontinental Champion William Regal vs Rob Van Dam. RVD's WM debut as this was a good physical contest with both men actually suffering a busted lip at one point & check out one reverse suplex that Regal delivered to RVD as it was really impactful.WWF European Champion DDP vs Christian. This was DDP's best match during his WWF run (which didn't work out so well) as it was both men going back & forth with the story of Christian trying to prevent his "temper tantrums" from getting in his way adding comedy to the match.Hardcore Champion Maven vs Goldust. This was just Goldust giving Maven a beating using trash cans & a shovel (all covered in gold by the way) before both men knocked each other out till Spike Dudley took advantage that lead to a series of skits throughout the night with the title constantly changing hands.Kurt Angle vs Kane. Before the match, Kurt cut a hilarious promo as he was insulting the Canadian Gold Medalists. This was one of Kane's best "wrestling" matches as Kurt brought out the best in him & even worked on his concussion injury that even had Kurt jump with a ringbell at the opening. The ending was a botched but it didn't take away from a solid match between these two.No Disqualification: The Undertaker vs Ric Flair. Flair started this match wild as he ran to the ring & attacked Taker before the bell even rang to the point where he threw himself onto Taker & into the announce table just to beat on him. From there, they told a good story as Taker took control & punished Flair but Flair just wouldn't quit. Both men were busted open at times & used a lead pipe & steel chair but one highlight to watch is Arn Anderson returning to deliver the spinebuster on Taker.Edge vs Booker T. If you can get pass the storyline going into this match (shampoo commercial?), this was a nice match to watch as both worked well together with Edge even doing his own "spinarooni" at one point during the match.Stone Cold Steve Austin vs Scott Hall. This was the best that Hall looked during this run as he held his own & brawled with Austin with the action getting out of control when Kevin Nash started getting involved to take out one referee after another. In the end, Austin overcame the odds to fight off Hall & Nash in what was good but not classic match.Elimination Match: WWF Tag Team Champions Billy & Chuck vs APA vs Hardy Boyz vs Dudley Boyz. This was a nice match to watch but this was nothing memorable past the way D-Von was thrown through a table since they did this match so many times during the Invasion angle that again, it was nothing special.The Rock vs Hollywood Hulk Hogan. This was the match that the crowd wanted to see more than anything else as this was the loudest the crowd got non-stop all night & even went back & forth among both men even before the bell rang. As for the match itself, Hogan & Rock brought their best & delivered a great back & forth action match with both men stealing their taunts at times & Hogan even doing the "Rock Bottom". A true classic even down to the shocking aftermath.Women's Champion Jazz vs Trish Stratus vs Lita. This didn't & couldn't top the previous match but these three put on a good match with each woman getting a chance to shine along with the story of Trish & Lita trying to double-team Jazz but they couldn't get along amongst themselves.Undisputed WWF Champion Chris Jericho vs Triple H. Despite this match being the title match & the history between these two, this was more about the issues between Triple H & Stephanie as this was the story told throughout the whole match instead of both men putting on a great performance. This wasn't a bad match but this was lackluster & not a good way to end the show & that is not including the predictable ending.DVD extras include the main event of WrestleMania VI which was the Title vs. Title battle between WWF Champion Hulk Hogan vs Intercontinental Champion Ultimate Warrior (one of both men's best matches in their careers), WM Fan Axxess, the Rock telling a Hulk Story, post match comments, & the following night on RAW where Hogan got quite the reception from the crowd.In the end, even though this was a step down from the previous WrestleMania event, there wasn't a bad match on the card & with all of the extras, this one is worth getting your hands on.

reviewText: OK, I'm going to be honest. I've not seen this DVD, nor did I watch WrestleMania X8 on TV. But there's a good reason.It's because I was there.Honestly, there is no media available than can encapsulate the feeling that I had as The Rock and Hollywood Hulk Hogan stood fact to face in front of 68,000 fans. Predictably, the match wasn't the classic that some are claiming that it was, but the emotion and crowd involvement put it in the same league as Undertaker/Mankind at King Of The Ring 1998 - great spectacle, average wrestling.Unfortunately, nothing could match that on the night. Triple H vs. Chris Jericho was something of a letdown, as Stephanie McMahon made sure that she was the centre of attention, making the true stars play second fiddle to her shimmery blue catsuit and lack of suitable underwear.Edge, Christian and Trish Stratus' Toronto homecomings were slightly disappointing, though in Trish's case, this could be to do with the fact that she was utterly dire in the ring, leaving Jazz to clean up the mess that her and Lita made. Edge vs. Booker T was let down by the storyline that preceded it. A match at WrestleMania over a shampoo commercial? Please.Best bump of the night has to be Mighty Molly Holly, who sold the impact of a door so convincingly that we all thought she had actually hit it.Also, keep an eye of Drowning Pool's rendition of Tear Away, which fell horribly flat due to the poor justaposition of the song in the event, meaning that all the fans were sitting...waiting for the next match. reviewText: From Top To Bottom Wrestlemania 18 was not bad in any way. Sure the hype was there but I don't know why the WWF/WWE invested so much time on old wrestlers coming back.  I really think as of today wrestling is not as domininat as before I ,and feel Wrestlemania 18 has something to do with it. Bringing back the old, overated washed up has been hollywood Hulk Hogan to face the rock was did bring a lot of hype but was a big mistake to for the WWF/WWE.  This match which was Supposed to be one for the ages was actually not a bad match but it took a long way to get there and both men took so much time staring at each other throughout the match.  Personally I did not care who won the match but scripting the rock to win was the right thing to do, since hogan was so slow and washed uo and had not wrestled for several years.  The original plan was having Stone Cold wrestle Hollywood Hulk Hogan, but Stone Cold refused which I am glad he did because Austin felt Hogan was a waste of his time which he would have been if they fought.  As for Austin's Match, it was a disgrace to put the greatest wrestler ever up against Scott Hall. No Scott Hall does not [...] but to make him fight against Austin as a midcard not Title Match was plain stupid.  No wonder why Austin was so angry at the WWF/WWE.  Austin Should Have been fighting someone like Triple H, Chris Jericho, Chris Benoit, Kurt Angle Or the Undertaker in a Title Match and a Main Event Type of match. Speaking of the Undertaker his fight with Ric Flair was nice and bloody and a decent match but Flair who is a better techinal wrestler than hogan was kind of old to be fighting. Kane was a very good match.  I would have liked to see Kane get the Win but did not have a big problem with Angle winning.  As far as the main event was concerned, Chris Jericho Vs. Overall Wrestlemania 18 was ok but there was too much hype for this subpar Wrestlemania.

reviewText: Well here it is, the 18th WrestleMania. A night filled with solid perfrmances in just about every match. Here's a rundown of the matches and the rating out of 5 *****Intercontinental Title: William Regal v.s. Rob Van DamThis match was a pretty good one, but not really one of the best Intercontinental Title matches of all time. Sort of depressing that RVD didn't go all out for WrestleMania. Oh well. He takes a heck of a bump by Regal though. I don't know how he didn't hurt his neck after that. ***European Title: Diamond Dallas Page v.s. ChristianThis match would turn out to be DDP's last match on Pay-Per-View and the last European Title match at WrestleMania. Too bad it wasn't all that good. Still, a good performance was put on by both men. **3/4Hardcore Title: Goldust v.s. MavenHave you noticed that the first three titles on the line in this PPV are currently no longer around? This match is hard to call since it takes advantage of the 24:7 rule all throughout the night. A high point in the Hardcore Title madness is the hilarious Hurricane and Molly winning the Hardcore Title(!) **3/4Kane v.s. Kurt AngleA great match but with a bad ending. It's very surprising to see how dominate Kurt was in this match. This was Kane's last PPV match until he returned to PPV at Unforgiven this year. Great match. ***1/4Ric Flair v.s. UndertakerAwesome match right here. Some spots are a little messed up, but both men make up for it. The ending is great (especially for an Undertaker fan) as he ends it with a Tombstone Piledriver to take his WrestleMania win/loss record to 10-0. ****Edge v.s. Booker TGood match, bad storyline (they're fighting because got a shampoo commercial deal in Japan and Booker didn't).Both men have great talents but they unfortunatley don't show a lot of it here. But at least we get to see an Edge-A-Roonie. **3/4Stone Cold Steve Austin v.s. Scott HallPretty much a brawl, but a very good brawl. This would be Stone Cold and Scott Hall's very last WrestleMania (sadly). Austin dishes out more Stunners than I think he's ever done at any other WrestleMania. Really good match. ***1/2Tag Team Title: Dudleys v.s. Hardys v.s. Billy & Chuck v.s. APAThis be a Fatal Four Way Elimination Match. It definetly couldn't top WM 17 TLC II match but it was still pretty good. I think they should have made this match TLC IV but that's just me.***The Rock v.s. Hollywood Hulk HoganThis is the match that Toronto fans were waiting all night for as they went nuts throughout the whole match. This was pretty much the unexpected rebirth of Hulkamania as he got the most cheers from everyone (the people even broke the 'ol "Rocky Sucks!" chant). This match was mostly entertainment filled with some pretty good wrestling thrown in. Toronto's match of the night. ****Women's Title: Jazz v.s. Lita v.s. TrishThis match got nearly no reaction since it had to follow Rock/Hogan (but how could they stay silent with Trish in an outfit like that?!) In a funny sidenote, during the match, Lita lifts up her shirt and the crowd begins to roar but then the shirt slips down again and we hear a loud depressed sigh (from fans all over the world, not just in Toronto). Disapointing that Jazz won though. **1/2Undisputed WWF Title: Chris Jericho v.s. Triple HEven this match didn't get much reaction. Chris Jericho main events WrestleMania for the very first time and he even goes in as the champion. The match had a predictable ending but it was still a pretty good match. A lot of it was Jericho just going after HHH's injured knee though. Still, a very good effort. ***3/4All in all, WrestleMania X8 will most likely not dissapoint. Every match was good and much entertainment is found on this PPV.

reviewText: This dvd is now out of print, but its worth tracking down. This event was recently rereleased in the big Wrestlemania DVD box set, but it was heavily edited in order to meet with copyrights. Aside from changing music in the rerelease, they had to blur the WWF logo and edit out any mentions of the initials "WWF".  This original dvd had no editing.THE EVENT* Intercontinental Title: William Regal (c) vs. Rob Van Dam* European Title: Diamond Dallas Page (c) vs. Christian* Hardcore Title: Goldust vs. Maven (c)* Tear Away: Drowning Pool sings a song* Kane vs. Kurt Angle* No Choice - video package of Flair & Undertaker's feud* Ric Flair vs. Undertaker. This dvd keeps Undertaker's Limp Bizkit theme, which is edited out of other events (including the rerelease of this event)* Edge vs. Booker T (last time Edge's Rob Zombie music was not removed from a dvd)* nWo picks the wrong guy - video package of Austin & Hall's feud* Steve Austin vs. Scott Hall* Tag Title Elimination Match: Billy & Chuck (c) vs. the Hardy Boyz vs. the APA vs. the Dudley Boyz* Icon vs. Icon - video package of Rock & Hogan's feud* The Rock vs. Hollywood Hogan (a classic for the ages)* Women's Title: Jazz (c) vs. Lita vs. Trish* Undisputed Title: Chris Jericho (c) vs. Triple H* Wrestlemania 18 highlightsEXTRASDisc 1* Byte This with Vince.* Favorite WM Moments.* Top 5 WM finishes* Top 3 WM attendences* Post Match Comments: RVD, DDP, & Angle* Making of the cast: talks about making a cast of Stacy's legs* Press Conference.Disc 2* Wrestlemania 6's Main Event: Hogan vs. Ultimate Warrior. This was placed on the dvd because it was the main event of the last Wrestlemania to hit Toronto. Great classic match.* The Rock challenges Hogan: This is the full scene from Raw when The Rock confronted Hogan and challenged him to a match. Great moment.* The Rock tells a Hulk Story: This is from the fanfest during the weekend before WM18. The Rock talks about his brief encounter with Hogan as a child. Funny!* The Next Night on Raw: On Raw, the following night, we see Hogan quit the nWo* Cat Fight: Lita & Trish fight backstage on Smackdown* Post Match Comments: Trish & Maven.Overall, I highly recommend this DVD. Its a great event with fun matches. This is definitely one to add to your collection whether you're a hardcore collector or just a relaxed fan.
